description: Founded in 1886, Buckeye Partners, L.P. has a proven track record of stability and success. We pride ourselves on the laser focus we apply to safely providing service and value to our customers, operating under a strong set of values, and empowering our employees to make decisions. We have a tenacious commitment to environmental responsibility and regulatory compliance in all that we do.It is our internal culture that sets us apart from other companies. Our goal is to provide our employees with a greater span of responsibility, the ability to make decisions, and access to experts to help you build your skills and experiences. Each of our career tracks provides employees with the ability to innovate, and be a significant contributor from their first day on the job.Buckeye Partners is currently seeking aDirector, Business Development / BDL Customer Servicewith extensive experience in a Sales, Marketing, Logistics, and Business Development in the Oil, Gas, Chemical Industry to join our team!Role SummaryThe Director, Business Development / BDL Customer Service role is responsible for directing and contributing to revenue growth, business development and customer satisfaction initiatives for the Buckeye Development & Logistics (BDL) organization.Essential Duties & Responsibilities IncludeDirector for 3rd Party Service Business. Oversee profitability levels of existing contract logistics portfolio and future contract logistics and asset development activities. Liaise with internal stakeholders of the business, including Operations, Financial Accounting on budget process, profitability metrics and implement process changes as necessary.Customer Relations. Work to expand BDL portfolio beyond existing operations and develop customer relationships that enable the segment to capture higher-valued opportunities. Evaluating customer service satisfaction to maintain existing core business and supporting efforts to establish company policies, goals and objectives as it relates to customer satisfaction and corporate profitability.Resolving Business Issues. Developing an understanding of how customers may benefit from BDL services and working with them to identify service solutions to resolve their business issues.New Business Opportunities. Develop new business opportunities for 3rd party service business, as well as other enterprise opportunities by demonstrating return on investment, risk evaluations and other economic hurdles necessary to meet revenue goals.Business Cases and Financial Models. Developing business cases and financial models to assess attractiveness of opportunities for commercial viability and strategic fit.EPC Project Development. Develop and evaluate opportunities to provide EPC services for large scale projects with new and existing customers.Business Development Projects. Overseeing corporate business development projects as it relates to chemical storage services and the development of financial models for potential transactions and/or capital projects, analyses and presentations as well as conduct research and analysis.Contract and Agreement Preparation. Preparing customer contracts and agreements for business development activity.Market and Trends Analysis. Monitoring the current BDL & chemical markets, customer and competitive environments and trends, conducting business intelligence research and identifying and evaluate market conditions or changes in the industry that may provide business growth opportunities. Researching, maintaining, and presenting competitive intelligence on service capabilities and pricing structures.Establishing and maintaining a network of current and potential business relationships with Petrochemicals, Refiners, Producers, Traders and other appropriate personnel.And other duties as assigned.Position RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Engineering or other related discipline required.MBA preferred.10+ years industry related experience in the commercial business development for the transporting, storage, and handling of refined products and specialty chemicals.Knowledge of rail and marine chemical transportation infrastructure routes within the US.Proven track record with the successful execution of commercial business contracts within the chemical transportation and storage industry.Must have proven experience developing and maintaining customer relationships.Up to 50% travel.Certificates & LicensesNone requiredOther Skills, Attributes And AbilitiesThis job includes frequent interaction with a wide range of (internal and external) personnel, which requires excellent interpersonal, communications, negotiating and customer service skills.Solid analytical skills are required.The incumbent must be a self-starter and spend at least 50% of time with existing or potential customers.An extensive business acumen is critical, with demonstrated ability to recognize key business drivers, and understanding of finance, accounting, and legal issues.Solid analytical skills and a strong proficiency in valuation analysis, financial modeling, and presentations.Strong networking and organizational skills are critical.Ability and willingness to travel is required.Essential FunctionsThis position requires the ability to safely and successfully perform essential job functions consistent with ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and or/quantitative productivity standards.This role requires the ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.This position requires compliance with all personnel policies.Safety And Physical RequirementsThe person in this position needs to occasionally move inside the office to access file cabinets, office equipment, etc.The incumbent in this role may occasionally need to wear Fire Retardant Clothing (FRC) and/or Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).The employee is frequently required to effectively communicate with others.About YouTo be successful in the Buckeye culture, our employees must Possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. You must be able to work independently. You must also be able to exercise tact, discretion, and professionalism when dealing with internal clients and external counterparties (customers, vendors, etc.), as well as when handling sensitive and confidential information.Buckeye Partners wants to create and reward an organizational focus that stimulates the creative and entrepreneurial actions of our employees and results in innovative ways of reducing costs, generating revenues, improving productivity, or improving processes.About UsBuckeye Partners, L.P. is the logistical solutions partner of choice for the global energy business and one of the nation’s largest independent petroleum products pipeline transportation and terminalling service provider; our strength is to create centers of expertise around our products, technologies and client needs.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. We are also an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans. Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP on the following website: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm #J-18808-Ljbffr
